class_notes: This course explores the history of the Eastern Roman Empire, or Byzantium, from the founding of the city of Constantinople in 330 to its fall in 1453. While the Western Roman Empire fell and was carved into smaller kingdoms that would become the nations of western Europe, the eastern half of the Roman Empire did not fall to barbarians, but stood for another thousand years, producing one of the richest material cultures the world has ever seen.
course_description: History of the Byzantine Empire from Justinian to the fall of Constantinople in 1453. Explores artistic, religious, and political achievements of one of the most magnificent and little-known civilizations in the Western tradition.
